The F-score is a measure that combines both precision and recall, providing a single value that represents the overall accuracy of a classification model. In the past study, the F-score was reported to be 95% for >25% interstitial fibrosis and tubular atrophy, 100% for necrotising glomerular lesions, and 100% for interstitial infiltrate.
